column2: Channel classification method to use. Either "static" or "local".
If channel detection method is "local": the window size expressed in number of grid cells to be used.
Value between 0 and 1 to determine channel detection sensitivity. e.g. if the postprocessing is too eager in detecting channels, lower this number.
Delta top with higher depth than this value is considered subaqeous. Value is typically based on tidal range (for parts that are always submerged).
Expected width (from an aerial view) of the delta front in number of grid cells
Minimum sand fraction of deposited material expected in the delta front.
Distance from channel endpoints to look for the 'mouthbar' architectural element
Minimum deposition rate in the delta front area for it to be considered a mouthbar (provided that it is located close enough to the endpoint of an active channel)
Minimum deposition rate within a channel system for it to be considered a mouthbar (provided that it is located close enough to subaqeous delta top or delta front)
Minimum deposition rate in the subaqeous delta top area for it to be considered a mouthbar (provided that it is located close enough to the endpoint of an active channel)
